result.execSummary:
The defendant Thomas B Missouri was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments, Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Thomas B Missouri
Current: 435 N. 7th Street, Rear, Manitowoc, WI 54220   (Effective: 01-10-2022)
Prior: 722 Waldo Blvd, Manitowoc, WI 54220

State moves to delete the penalty enhancer on count 2.   Motion granted.    
Count 2 - Disorderly conduct (DVO) - Guilty plea.   Convicted.   State moves to dismiss and read in count 1.   Motion granted.   
$100.00 fine, plus costs imposed, total of $679.00, to be paid by 11-09-22 or 14 days jail.   Submit DNA sample.   
Minutes.
Plea date on September 9, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Plea date on September 9, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Stipulation and Order to Modify No Contact Order to No Assaultive Contact.
1. The State was made aware that E.A.W. wished to modify the original no contact order to allow for contact between E.A.W. and Mr. Missouri since E.A.W. had Mr. Missouri's child on May 3, 2022.
2. E.A.W. did not appear at the court hearing held on May 19, 2022 but has since contacted the State and continued to express her desire to have the original no contact order modified.
3. The State informed Attorney McCann on May 23, 2022 that E.A.W. has provided the State with proof of completing the necessary safety planning.

Stipulation and Order to Modify No Contact Order to No Assaultive Contact.
1. The State was made aware that E.A.W. wished to modify the original no contact order to allow for contact between E.A.W. and Mr. Missouri since E.A.W. had Mr. Missouri's child on May 3, 2022.
2. E.A.W. did not appear at the court hearing held on May 19, 2022 but has since contacted the State and continued to express her desire to have the original no contact order modified.
3. The State informed Attorney McCann on May 23, 2022 that E.A.W. has provided the State with proof of completing the necessary safety planning.

MOTION TO MODIFY CONDITION OF BAIL
Attorney McCann received a text message from the victim asking that the defendant be able to have contact with their baby which was just born on 05-03-22.  Human Services is involved and is currently restricting contact with the child because of the no contact with the mother.
The parties argue the motion.
Since Human Services is involved, the court indicates they could coordinate contacts/visits with the child without the victim being involved. Therefore, the Court will amend the condition of bail to state, "defendant must have no contact with E.A.W., DOB: 06-03-1988 or any premises E.A.W. occupies.  3rd party contact with E.A.W., DOB: 06-03-1988 is permitted as long as 3rd party is a representative of the Human Services Department".
Scheduling conference is set for 07-27-22 at 9:00 a.m.

Attorney James Gregory McCann appeared by video for Thomas B Missouri.  Substitution request has been filed.  Initial appearance will be reset when new judge is assigned.

records.addlTxt: James McCann, through Public Defender.

10:44 am - Prosecuting attorney Angelina R Scarpelli appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin, by zoom. Defendant Thomas B Missouri appeared by video, in custody at Manitowoc County Jail. Defendant requests counsel and is referred to the public defender.
Initial appearance scheduled for January 31, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Victim Identification Key.
RE:  Battery-dvo-dvo repeater, on 12-26-21.
Order for prints.

Order to Seal Probable Cause Statement.
The original document was titled: Probable cause statement /judicial determination
The original history event date is: 12-28-2021

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crime of battery-dvo.  The matter is continued for initial appearance on 01-20-22 at 10:30 a.m. B-15.  Bail is set at $500.00 recognizance bond with the conditions that he provide an address to the Clerk of Court office, in writing, within 48 hours of release and that he have no contact with E.A.W., DOB: 06-03-1988 or any premises E.A.W. occupies.   Bail furnished and defendant is remanded into custody on a probation hold. Court orders photos and prints at MTPD.
Minutes.
